items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message: Water levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast shows no current flood risk from high tides. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: Wyre estuary from Fleetwood and Knott End to Little Eccleston
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at 01:30 PM on 28/10/2022.
Strong winds and spring tides may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast.
Tides are expected to be higher than usual due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides.

As a result of high spring tides, tides will be at their highest today at 01:15 PM on 28/10/2022. Areas most at risk include Coast at North Morecambe Bay from Roosebeck to Carnforth including low lying areas around Ulverston, Greenodd, Haverthwaite, Flookburgh, Grange-over-Sands, Levens, Milnthorpe, Sandside, Arnside and Silverdale between 11:15 AM 28/10/2022 and 03:15 PM 28/10/2022. We will continue to monitor the forecast.  Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 17:00 PM on 28/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message: The forecast has changed and the forecast high water at 10:30 PM on Thursday 27/10/2022 has now dropped to a level of 1.14mAODN with southerly force 4 winds. The next forecast high water is at 10:45 AM on Friday 28/10/2022 with a level of 1.20mAODN and westerly force 6 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level - for more detail refer to local tide tables.) Areas most at risk include Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon. Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of these times. After this tideâ€š the weather is more settled and no further impacts are expected. We are monitoring the situation and will close locks and flood gates if needed. Consider activating any property flood protection products in Christchurch Harbour. This message will be updated by 01:00 PM on 28/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Lizard Point to Gribbin Head excluding Truro City
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
Tides will now continue to decrease towards neaps.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

This Flood Alert has been issued due to forecasted high tides. Areas most at risk include West Bay Harbour and the tidal stretch of the River Brit. The detailed tidal information for those who use it is for a peak level at West Bay Harbour. The first forecast high water is at 07:45 PM on Thursday 27/10/2022 with a level of 2.47 mAODN with southerly force 3 winds. The second forecast high water is at 08:00 AM on Friday 28/10/2022 with a level of 2.54 mAODN and south westerly force 6 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level - for more detail refer to local tide tables.) Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of this time. After this tideâ€š the weather is more settled and no further impacts are expected. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 28/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Friday morning. High water at Exmouth is at 9.15am, times of high water will vary along the coast.
Strong force 5 south westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 1.3m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations.  Expect tides to be around 360mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.
Detailed tidal information for those who use it; the forecast high tide level at Exmouth is 2.49 mAOD, this is 0.36 metres above astronomical tide level.

items.description: North Devon coast from Hartland Point to Lynmouth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the sea has now reduced, however, gale force winds are still forecast, so take care near coastal paths and promenades.
This Flood Alert for Berwick Between Bridges has now been removed. There is no longer risk to areas by the estuary as wave overtopping and spray has reduced. We continue to monitor the situation.
